statement: The Lab TUI is not yet sufficient for a clean MVP operator flow because run creation depends on hidden env flags and hard-coded experiment settings instead of explicit UI/CLI controls.
rationale: TUI only bootstraps when LAB_BOOTSTRAP/NEW_RUN are set and uses static EXPERIMENT_SETTINGS.
keyAssumptions: Operators need visible run creation controls
Hidden env flags are unacceptable for MVP UX
validationCriteria: Lab can start and create a run without manual env flags or code edits
Experiment parameters can be selected at runtime
critiquePoints: A manual CLI flow could substitute for missing TUI controls in the short term
questions: Do we want MVP to rely on CLI only, or must the TUI be first-class?
